intro: Viola hortensis var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered violet, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces showy, violet-blue flowers with yellow centers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm and thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and borders. The species is well-suited for partial shade and is known for its ability to naturalize in suitable conditions.
